meanings.definition: A category in biological classification above an order and below a class.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use superorders to organize living things into groups.
meanings.sent2: The superorders help scientists understand the relationships between different species.
meanings.sent3: The superorders at the zoo had a meeting to discuss their classification.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the superorders of animals worked together like a well-organized team.
meanings.sent5: Learning about superorders makes studying biology more interesting and structured.

meanings.definition: A group of related orders in biological classification.
meanings.sent1: The superorders of birds and reptiles share common characteristics.
meanings.sent2: Each superorders consists of several different orders of organisms.
meanings.sent3: At the biology conference, the superorders mingled and exchanged ideas.
meanings.sent4: The superorders in the ecosystem formed a complex network of interactions.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the superorders in nature reveals the interconnectedness of life forms.
